thread.section_title: Yahoo! Finance: Heavy Construction Industry News
thread.title: Tutor Perini misses 2Q profit forecasts

title: Tutor Perini misses 2Q profit forecasts
text:
Tutor Perini misses 2Q profit forecasts Tutor Perini misses 2Q net income expectations, tops revenue forecasts 3 hours ago Done 
SYLMAR, Calif. (AP) _ Tutor Perini Corp. (TPC) on Thursday reported second-quarter net income of $11.8 million. 
The Sylmar, California-based company said it had profit of 24 cents per share. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs, were 41 cents per share. 
The results missed Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of three analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of 53 cents per share. 
The construction company posted revenue of $1.31 billion in the period, which topped Street forecasts. Three analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $1.24 billion. 
Tutor Perini expects full-year earnings to be $1.90 to $2 per share, with revenue in the range of $5 billion to $5.5 billion. 
Tutor Perini shares have dropped 17 percent since the beginning of the year. In the final minutes of trading on Thursday, shares hit $20.07, a decline of 30 percent in the last 12 months.
